text: <@U01CVQ02E5S> Solid topics. I think I'd speak most valuably to 1 and 3— #2 is a big 'it depends IMO,' slash have immense attention to detail and read a lot about it. For #4 i personally haven't negotiated a whole lot in my career, moreso I set the price and the price is the price :slightly_smiling_face:

text: Cool. There's a lot of good nuance in the question! It's never as simple as "just write some words." Half the time you find out they need technical help too if you're dealing with the company directly. When you say "brands" do you mean something specific, or is that interchangeable with "any client hiring a freelance writer?"

elements.text: Cool. There's a lot of good nuance in the question! It's never as simple as "just write some words." Half the time you find out they need technical help too if you're dealing with the company directly. When you say "brands" do you mean something specific, or is that interchangeable with "any client hiring a freelance writer?"

text: Oh yeah definitely. In my experience it's rarely as simple as putting words to paper, most companies need a lot more. Yeah so when I say brands, I really am talking about businesses that would be hiring writers. I'm in the B2B space, as are the developing writers I work with, so I just try and instill into them to think of their clients as brands, with their own voice, POV etc.

text:
:loudspeaker:  Launching episode 6 of the *SaaS Content at Scale.* 

In this episode, I talk to <@U011G8QM6HK>, content & communications manager at *Bannersnack*, an online graphic design tool that's powerful and super easy to use.

It's more like a 1 hour masterclass on content strategy (and other topics) but here are the _highlights_:

:writing_hand: How they center their strategy around a single product/feature page and create 'clusters' around it. It's a highly effective strategy that led Bannersnack to increase its *organic traffic by 61%*.

:writing_hand: How to create unique content for your company (I mean never-found-before-on-the-internet).

:writing_hand: The content marketing best practices that you should implement to launch a new feature.

:writing_hand: How to leverage *Pinterest as a search engine* to understand the user's intention & create visual content from around it.

It's an awesome episode jam-packed with tactical advice. You can't miss it!

:headphones: <http://bit.ly/scas-ep6|bit.ly/scas-ep6>

As usual, let me know if you have any feedback. Always looking for constructive suggestions! :slightly_smiling_face:
